senses.de: Receptive to; willing to consider or accept.
senses.ex: I'm open to suggestions for our next vacation.

Tips.title: Expressing willingness
Tips.description: Use 'open to' to show you are willing to consider something, even if you're not sure about it yet.
Tips.example: I'm open to trying that new restaurant you mentioned.

Tips.title: Negotiations and discussions
Tips.description: Use 'open to' to signal flexibility and willingness to compromise.
Tips.example: We are open to discussing the terms of the contract further.

senses.ex: Leaving the window open made the house open to burglars.

Tips.title: Describing vulnerability
Tips.description: Use 'open to' to describe something that is susceptible to negative influences or actions.
Tips.example: The system is open to hacking if the password isn't strong enough.

Receptive.wordDefinition: 'Receptive' emphasizes a willingness to receive and consider new ideas, while 'open to' suggests a broader willingness to accept different possibilities or experiences, including potentially negative ones.

Amenable.wordDefinition: 'Amenable' often implies a willingness to cooperate or comply, while 'open to' focuses more on a willingness to consider or accept.
